titleStmt.title: William T. Samuels to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5020

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Auditor's Office, Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS,
Attorney at Law & General Collecting Agent,
Frankfort, KY.
&#9758Special attention given to the collection of all claims confided to him throughout the State of Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS, Auditor.
EDGAR KEENON, Ass't Auditor.
James M. Withrow, Clerk.
Uberto Keenon, Clerk.
R.R. Bacon, Clerk.
John A. Crittenden, Clerk.
Jno. W. Pruett, Jr., Clerk.
Charles T. Miller, Clerk.
John L. Sneed, Clerk.

Frankfort, Ky., May 24th, 1864.
Hon Tho. E. Bramlette
Gov. of Ky.
Dr. Sir,

All the revenue charged to J. N. Hill, as Shff of Madison County for 1861, has this day been paid and now prays your Excellency to be relieved from the payment of Twenty Five Hundred and Thirty Nine 23/100 Dollars, this being the amt. adjudged against him for the non payment of the Revenue in time as required by law, as Damages.
Resply.
W. T Samuels
Auditor

Madison Co.
vs
J. N. Hill
Shff

Remit damages
Thos E Bramlette
Damages
$2539.23
24th May/64
